title: Netflix Just Blessed Us With The ‘Queer Eye: We’re In Japan’ Trailer & Prepare To Cry
text:
Friends, I hope you’re ready to aggressively sob because Netflix just dropped the trailer for the Queer Eye Japan special and oh, my God – if the trailer is anything to go by, we’re in for a bloody doozy.

In Queer Eye: We’re In Japan, angels Jonathan Van Ness, Bobby Berk, Karamo Brown, Tan France, and Antoni Porowski travel to Tokyo to spread their message of self-care and compassion to four heroes. They’re guided by American-Japanese model Kiko Mizuhara, with a fab guest appearance from comedian and actor Naomi Watanabe.

Unlike the teaser released a little while back, this trailer gives us a sneak peek at the four heroes – like this one bloke who wants “to transform from a rock to a psychedelic flower.” IS THAT NOT THE SWEETEST THING EVER?

There’s also Yoko, a woman who gave up every room in her house for her patients. I’m getting major Mama Tammye vibes from her.

To summarise: JVN cries, Antoni cries, the heroes cry, I cry. I’m not ready.

Queer Eye: We’re In Japan hits Netflix, November 1.

Give ’em another damn Emmy.
